metadata.Title: CVE-2015-8327 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Incomplete blacklist vulnerability in util.c in foomatic-rip in cups-filters 1.0.42 before 1.2.0 and in foomatic-filters in Foomatic 4.0.x allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary commands via ` (backtick) characters in a print job.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8327` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

cups-browsed - 1.0.52-0ubuntu1.6
cups-filters - 1.0.52-0ubuntu1.6
cups-filters-core-drivers - 1.0.52-0ubuntu1.6
libcupsfilters1 - 1.0.52-0ubuntu1.6
libfontembed1 - 1.0.52-0ubuntu1.6
No subscription required

foomatic-filters - 4.0.17-1+deb7u1ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> Per Debian, introduced in cups-filters 1.0.42 and foomatic-filters 4.0-20090301

criterions.comment: cups-filters package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.52-0ubuntu1.6').
foomatic-filters package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.0.17-1+deb7u1ubuntu0.14.04.1').
